q1: What is a user agent string?
a1: A user agent string is a text identifier sent by your browser with every HTTP request, containing information about your browser, OS, and device.
q2: Can I parse any user agent?
a2: Yes, paste any user agent string into the text area. The parser handles all major browsers and operating systems.
a3: The tool automatically loads your current browser's user agent string from navigator.userAgent for quick analysis.
a4: Blink (Chrome, Edge, Opera), Gecko (Firefox), WebKit (Safari), and Trident (Internet Explorer).
